#55 Set From property in mail message 

Some email servers do not use the Sender property in the mail header to derive who the "from" address should be, and will either spam emails, or send emails "from" and "unknown sender" as a result. 
so adding the From property fixes this for emails servers which use this.

Adding PagerDuty Notifications to Seyren, this makes use of biz.neustar PagerDuty work (https://github.com/webmetrics/pagerduty-java).
Its not perfect, but thats more due to the model than the work ive added, for some reason the last change introduced to the main repo added a new method to the NotificationService.java interface all other notifications are supposedly meant to implement, question why you would have a sendemailstatus method you want to override in all other types of notifcation services?? but for now, just going to get in the changes, also need to look at the whole structure as the current model doesnt really work for anything more than one notification type of email, unless my java can be improved and we can somehow infer at runtime which notification type to fire off based on the notification type of the subscription being checked.
any improvements/comments are welcome.

Added HpChat Notifications to Seyren, Uses hipchat api (https://www.hipchat.com/docs/api)
Works much like PagerDutyAlerts, when we get an Error we send a message to hipchat room with red color, when we get an OK, we send a message saying the check is back up with green color.
Have skipped warn thresholds in yellow color, I had it in, but too it out as when you have checks which flap between error and ok a lot, the chatrooms become to noisy, although if you want that back in its easy enough to add it.
Made smtp protocol setting configurable, default is smtp for authenticated email, but can now pass in smtps if needed.  Which i do.

Reordered 'Stand alone' build steps

After `SeyrenConfigTest.java` was introduced all seyren environment variables must be empty to prevent breaking the `mvn clean package` command (i.e. the SeyrenConfigTest tests fail when enviroment vars are set).

Therefore the `mvn clean package` should be run *before* any environment vars are set. I've updated the README's `Stand alone` section to reflect this necessity.

Live feature.

Instead of pulling all metrics with http, this feature allows Seyren to listen carbon relay (see pickle protocol http://graphite.readthedocs.org/en/latest/feeding-carbon.html).

I introduce live package where CarbonPickleListener, the TCP server (quick implementation), is located.
It reads inputstream socket, decode pickle protocol (with the help of jython, see maven dependency), and add a MetricsTask to an executor.
MetricsTask find all checks in MongoDb that are enabled and live, both with true value.
And of course, I re-use CheckRunner to store/send alert.

In "Check Dialog" UI, if "live" option is checked, the method for checking the check will be that described above, otherwise a 'classic' http check is used (default behaviour), it is exclusive.

Users are responsible to filter metrics in relay-rules.conf and not send all metrics to Seyren (to avoid performance problem).
Example: How to send to Seyren only 'load' metrics, edit /opt/graphite/conf/relay-rules.conf like and restart carbon-relay:

[seyren]
pattern = .*load.*
destinations = [ip seyren]:[port]:[instance]
continue = true

[default]
default = true
destinations = [ip carbon cache]:[port]:[instance]

Thera are some limitations:
* carbon-relay must have access Seyren (while http is easiest)
* metric sended via carbon-relay are raw value, you can not access to graphite functions

But with this feature, Seyren is more reactive.

Enjoy :)
Live feature documentation

Make a one jar file monolithic #149

Use tomcat7-maven-plugin to build an executable jar, see target/seyren-web-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT-war-exec.jar.

% java -jar seyren-web-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT-war-exec.jar
...
INFO: Starting Servlet Engine: Apache Tomcat/7.0.37
...
INFO: Starting ProtocolHandler ["http-bio-8080"]

Implementation notes:
- tomcat7-maven-plugin 2.2 does not work
- You can change http port with: jar target/seyren-web-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT-war-exec.jar -httpPort=9090
- tomcat7-maven-plugin creates seyren-web-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT-war-exec.jar but installs seyren-web-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT-exec-war.jar -> wierd

Update HttpClient and add in ability to control HttpClient timeouts

By default, Seyren is set-up using the default timeouts from Apache HttpClient (which are infinite). This remains the case for now, but in the future we might want to consider changing them for something sensible.

Merge branch 'master' of github.com:scobal/seyren

Added support for optional fields 'from' and 'until' to a check.
If either field is set, its value is used when building the graph; otherwise, the previous defaults (-11minutes, -1minutes) are used.
Linkify check descriptions
Update README.md
Noop commit in hopes of forcing a CI build on the pull request.
Another no-op commit to force a CI build.
Specify Mongo version once
Tidy up some warnings
Prevent state and last updated date update from overwriting actual changes to the rest of the check
Update Mongo driver

Fix for checks with long targets not being able to save alerts

As of Mongo 2.6 there is a strictly-enforced 1024 byte length restriction on index keys. Our checkId + target can go above this given a sufficiently large target.

Issue-144 Allow custom email content

Configuration parameter for custom email template.
Loading of alternate template path.
De-static'ized the filename and content properties of the
VelocityEmailHelper to reflect their dependence on a SeyrenConfig only
available on instantiation.  Further de-static'ized the private method
that performed the one-time content initialization.
Added test locking down default.
Added stub test template for loading verification.
Added test that exercises alternatively configured test template.
Updated documentation.
Fix up documentation.

Arbitrary check search by fields and corresponding regular expression.

Modification of checks resource parameters to add fields and regexes.

Added acceptance tests demonstrating, documenting and enforcing usage of check search API.

An example URL is localhost:8080/api/checks?fields=name&patterns=test&fields=description&patterns=test.*description.*
Seems I managed to clean out subscriptions each time we saved a check
